instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.CHGR_BMON: What is CHGR_BMON? CHGR_BMON goes between the ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 that charges the battery & creates PPBUS_G3H and the SMC(system management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip) and provides current sensing information on battery charging to the SMC. If diagnostics reveal an off reading or failure with the charger current sense, this is a good place to start troubleshooting..
definitions.CHGR_AMON: What is CHGR_AMON? CHGR_AMON provides DC current sense information to the SMC(System management controller) or T2 chip(on machines where the SMC is integrated into the T2 chip). It comes from the battery charging chip that controls the laptop charger, battery charging, and creation of PPBUS_G3H(ISL6259, ISL9239, or ISL9240 chip depending on the logic board part number and model). This is used for sensors. If a DC current sense sensor is reading off in diagnostics, this is a place to start looking. .
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMCâ€™s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light ppbus cycling 15.8v to 4v
threads.message:
hi, this board came in with flux around smc, I have 3.3/3.4v at pp3v42, <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> and vcc, continuity good to adapter sense at pin 5 of j6900 too.. tried reflowing smc, sometimes it give green light but with looping fan spin every 3 second, but after a while, green light will be gone.
board start in smc bypass. ppbus is cycling from 15.8v to 4v, should I change smc first ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light ppbus cycling 15.8v to 4v
threads.message:
SMC should be reballed, at least.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> reaching 15.8V points to shorted <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light ppbus cycling 15.8v to 4v
threads.message:
the ppbus value is when I have changed the smc, looking at other post, I maybe have some issue with sensor..
i tried to reball and replace back the original smc, I have ppbus 12.6v , no green light, but start in smc bypass.. <SIGNAL>3V3_S5_AVREF</SIGNAL> is 3.3v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light ppbus cycling 15.8v to 4v
threads.message:
Check exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Also check <SIGNAL>CHGR_A</SIGNAL>/BMON levels.

Be sure <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> signal is good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light ppbus cycling 15.8v to 4v
threads.message:
17/18 : 3 ohm , 27/28 : 20 ohm, I have tried replacing <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> too.
<SIGNAL>CHGR_AMON</SIGNAL> 50mv
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON</SIGNAL> 300mv
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> : 2.7v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light ppbus cycling 15.8v to 4v
threads.message:
In normal mode, any pulse on coils at least?
Be sure <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> is OK.
Also check <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> levels.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light ppbus cycling 15.8v to 4v
threads.message:
in normal mode, I tried monitoring pulse on  L7260, L7330, L7510, no pulse.
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> is 3.3v
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL> : 0v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> : 0v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light ppbus cycling 15.8v to 4v
threads.message:
In normal  mode, trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>.
If yes, check for pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> signal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light ppbus cycling 15.8v to 4v
threads.message:
i leave the board for a few days, when I came back, there's no green light anymore, I think the green light only present when I charge other macbook and right away plugged it back to the board.
anyway, I already used smc from another board that surely have green light, but after replacing it, I srill doesnt have green light, even though I have sys one wire voltage. Ialready checked resistor   <RESISTOR>R4901</RESISTOR>/09 and <RESISTOR>R4902</RESISTOR>/98/99., allgood

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light ppbus cycling 15.8v to 4v
threads.message:
Try known good DCIN board.
Check continuity from <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> to central pin of Magsafe connector.
Post exact voltage at pins 4 & 5 of <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>.

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>?
What about <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage now?
